answers.answer: Vaccination serves as a means of preserving human health and life by protecting against infectious diseases and preventing dangerous complications.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/vaccination and read the section under 'Vaccination'.

answers.answer: The provided content states that vaccination is the only way to protect against infectious diseases and prevent dangerous complications, but does not detail the biological mechanism of how vaccines achieve this protection.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/vaccination and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Vaccinations can prevent diseases such as measles, rubella, polio, diphtheria, haemophilus influenza type b (Hib), tuberculosis, pertussis, tetanus, hepatitis B, mumps, rotavirus, pneumococcal infection, flu, meningococcus, and COVID-19.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/vaccination and read the section under 'Vaccination'.

answers.answer: Both children and adults should receive vaccinations to protect against infectious diseases and prevent dangerous complications.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/vaccination and read the section under 'Vaccination'.

answers.answer: Infants should begin their vaccination schedule immediately after birth with Hepatitis B and tuberculosis (BCG) vaccines, specifically Hepatitis B when the child weighs 2 kilograms or is 1 month old, and other vaccines from two months of age.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/vaccination and read the section under 'Calendar of mandatory vaccinations in Romania'.

answers.answer: If vaccinations are missed, individuals should make up for the schedule as soon as possible by scheduling the next vaccines with their doctor, ensuring to follow the intervals of doses for maximum effectiveness.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/vaccination and read the section under 'Important to remember!'.

answers.answer: Individuals can access vaccination services at the medical institution where a child was born, outpatient clinics, other clinics, or by contacting their nearest County Department for Public Health, healthcare provider, or health care team.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/vaccination and read the section under 'Calendar of mandatory vaccinations in Romania'.

answers.answer: Common reactions that might occur after vaccination include fever or muscle aches, which are considered normal.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/vaccination and read the section under 'COVID-19'.

answers.answer: Vaccinations do not weaken or overload the immune system because vaccine viruses are weakened. The load on the immune system from vaccination is significantly lower than from an actual infectious disease.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/vaccination and read the section under 'Important to remember!'.

answers.answer: In most cases, premature babies should be vaccinated at the same age and on the same schedule as full-term babies, regardless of birth weight, though Hepatitis B vaccination should be started when the child weighs 2 kilograms or is 1 month old.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/vaccination and read the section under 'Calendar of mandatory vaccinations in Romania'.

answers.answer: It is important for adults to get vaccinated, including against COVID-19, to protect themselves from diseases that can be avoided through vaccination.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/vaccination and read the section under 'COVID-19'.

answers.answer: Receiving multiple vaccines on the same day is a common international practice that reduces the number of injections and provides protection against several infections simultaneously.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/vaccination and read the section under 'Important to remember!'.

answers.answer: There is no need for additional tests such as blood, urine, or immunogram before vaccination.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/vaccination and read the section under 'Important to remember!'.

answers.answer: Chronic health conditions like asthma or diabetes are not contraindications to vaccination; instead, children with such conditions have a higher risk of severe infections, making vaccination even more crucial for their protection.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/vaccination and read the section under 'Important to remember!'.

answers.answer: After vaccination, individuals should allow 2-3 days for recovery, take a break, and avoid large crowds.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/vaccination and read the section under 'COVID-19'.
